title: Combining Contention-Based Spectrum Access and Adaptive Modulation using Deep Reinforcement Learning. (arXiv:2109.11723v3 [eess.SP] UPDATED)
abstract: The use of unlicensed spectrum for cellular systems to mitigate spectrum scarcity has led to the development of intelligent adaptive approaches to spectrum access that improve upon traditional carrier sensing and listen-before-talk methods. We study decentralized contention-based medium access for base stations (BSs) of a single Radio Access Technology (RAT) operating on unlicensed shared spectrum. We devise a distributed deep reinforcement learning-based algorithm for both contention and adaptive modulation, modelled on a two state Markov decision process, that attempts to maximize a network-wide downlink throughput objective. Empirically, we find the (proportional fairness) reward accumulated by a policy gradient approach to be significantly higher than even a genie-aided adaptive energy detection threshold. Our approaches are further validated by improved sum and peak throughput. The scalability of our approach to large networks is demonstrated via an improved cumulative reward earn

ret.translated_title: 利用深度强化学习结合竞争性基础频谱接入和自适应调制
ret.translated_abstract: 为了减轻频谱不足的压力，移动通信系统利用未许可的频谱，发展了智能自适应方法来改进传统的载波感知和听之前的方法。我们研究单个无线电访问技术（RAT）基站在未许可共享频谱上的分散式竞争基础媒介接入。我们设计了一种分布式基于深度强化学习的算法，用于竞争和自适应调制，建立在两状态马尔可夫决策过程上，旨在最大化网络范围内的下行吞吐量目标。在实验中，我们发现采用策略梯度方法累积的（比例公平性）奖励甚至比精灵辅助的自适应能量检测阈值高得多。我们的方法进一步通过改进的总和和峰值吞吐量得到验证。我们的方法的可扩展性通过改进的累积奖励获得证明。
ret.tldr: 本文介绍了一种利用深度强化学习结合竞争性基础频谱接入和自适应调制的方法，通过分布式深度强化学习算法最大化网络范围内的下行吞吐量，相比传统的自适应方法获得更高的奖励，并通过改进的总和和峰值吞吐量验证了方法的可行性。
